intro: Rubus laevicaulis, commonly known as the smooth blackberry shrub, is a species of brambles native to North America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained, loamy soils. Rubus laevicaulis is often found in open woodlands, thickets, and along stream banks.
